snippet: The Republican candidate for mayor denounced his Democratic rival’s endorsement of a new agency that would oversee the Police Department, calling it “dangerous.”
abstract: Joseph J Lhota, Republican candidate for New York City mayor, delivers blistering attack  on leading Democratic rival Christine C Quinn for endorsing creation of agency to independently monitor city’s Police Department; accuses Quinn, City Council speaker, of abdicating her responsibility to have Council monitor police force and instead seeking to offload task to an unnecessary bureaucracy.
lead_paragraph: The Republican candidate for mayor denounced his Democratic rival’s endorsement of a new agency that would oversee the Police Department, calling it “dangerous.”

headline.seo: Lhota Attacks Mayoral Rival Quinn’s Support for Police Monitor
headline.main: Lhota Turns Up Heat on Quinn for Supporting Police Monitor
headline.print_headline: Lhota Turns Up Heat on Quinn For Supporting Police Monitor
